title: Gordian II loses the Battle of Carthage against the Numidian forces loyal to Maximinus Thrax and is killed. Gordian I, his father, commits suicide.
text: • 238 – Gordian II loses the Battle of Carthage against the Numidian forces loyal to Maximinus Thrax and is killed. Gordian I, his father, commits suicide.

title: Shapur I becomes co
text: • 240 – Shapur I becomes co-emperor of the Sasanian Empire with his father Ardashir I.

title: Anthemius is elevated to Emperor of the Western Roman Empire.
text: • 467 – Anthemius is elevated to Emperor of the Western Roman Empire.

title: King Edwin of Northumbria is converted to Christianity by Paulinus, bishop of York.
text: • 627 – King Edwin of Northumbria is converted to Christianity by Paulinus, bishop of York.

title: Duke Oldřich of Bohemia deposes and blinds his brother Jaromír who flees to Poland.
text: • 1012 – Duke Oldřich of Bohemia deposes and blinds his brother Jaromír who flees to Poland.

title: King Karl Sverkersson of Sweden is murdered on Visingsö.
text: • 1167 – King Karl Sverkersson of Sweden is murdered on Visingsö.

title: The Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade breach the walls of Constantinople and enter the city, which they completely occupy the following day.
text: • 1204 – The Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade breach the walls of Constantinople and enter the city, which they completely occupy the following day.

title: The Union Flag is adopted as the flag of English and Scottish ships.
text: • 1606 – The Union Flag is adopted as the flag of English and Scottish ships.

title: American Revolution: With the Halifax Resolves, the North Carolina Provincial Congress authorizes its Congressional delegation to vote for independence from Britain.
text: • 1776 – American Revolution: With the Halifax Resolves, the North Carolina Provincial Congress authorizes its Congressional delegation to vote for independence from Britain.

title: The Froberg mutiny ends when the remaining mutineers blow up the magazine of Fort Ricasoli.
text: • 1807 – The Froberg mutiny ends when the remaining mutineers blow up the magazine of Fort Ricasoli.

title: Alexander Ypsilantis is declared leader of Filiki Eteria, a secret organization to overthrow Ottoman rule over Greece.
text: • 1820 – Alexander Ypsilantis is declared leader of Filiki Eteria, a secret organization to overthrow Ottoman rule over Greece.

title: Soldiers marching on the Broughton Suspension Bridge in Manchester, England cause it to collapse.
text: • 1831 – Soldiers marching on the Broughton Suspension Bridge in Manchester, England cause it to collapse.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Fort Sumter. The war begins with Confederate forces firing on Fort Sumter, in the harbor of Charleston, South Carolina.
text: • 1861 – American Civil War: Battle of Fort Sumter. The war begins with Confederate forces firing on Fort Sumter, in the harbor of Charleston, South Carolina.

title: American Civil War: The Andrews Raid (the Great Locomotive Chase) occurs, starting from Big Shanty, Georgia (now Kennesaw).
text: • 1862 – American Civil War: The Andrews Raid (the Great Locomotive Chase) occurs, starting from Big Shanty, Georgia (now Kennesaw).

title: American Civil War: The Battle of Fort Pillow: Confederate forces kill most of the African American soldiers that surrendered at Fort Pillow, Tennessee.
text: • 1864 – American Civil War: The Battle of Fort Pillow: Confederate forces kill most of the African American soldiers that surrendered at Fort Pillow, Tennessee.

title: American Civil War: Mobile, Alabama, falls to the Union Army.
text: • 1865 – American Civil War: Mobile, Alabama, falls to the Union Army.

title: The United Kingdom annexes the Transvaal.
text: • 1877 – The United Kingdom annexes the Transvaal.

title: SMS Zrínyi, one of the last pre
text: • 1910 – SMS Zrínyi, one of the last pre-dreadnought battleships built by the Austro-Hungarian Navy, is launched.

title: World War I: Canadian forces successfully complete the taking of Vimy Ridge from the Germans.
text: • 1917 – World War I: Canadian forces successfully complete the taking of Vimy Ridge from the Germans.

title: Shanghai massacre of 1927: Chiang Kai
text: • 1927 – Shanghai massacre of 1927: Chiang Kai-shek orders the Communist Party of China members executed in Shanghai, ending the First United Front.

title: Rocksprings, Texas was hit by an F5 tornado that destroyed 235 of the 247 buildings in the town and killed 72 townspeople and injured 205; third deadliest tornado in Texas history.
text: • 1927 – Rocksprings, Texas was hit by an F5 tornado that destroyed 235 of the 247 buildings in the town and killed 72 townspeople and injured 205; third deadliest tornado in Texas history.

title: The Bremen, a German Junkers W 33 type aircraft, takes off for the first successful transatlantic aeroplane flight from east to west.
text: • 1928 – The Bremen, a German Junkers W 33 type aircraft, takes off for the first successful transatlantic aeroplane flight from east to west.

title: The strongest surface wind gust in the world at the time of 231 mph, is measured on the summit of Mount Washington, New Hampshire. It has since been surpassed.
text: • 1934 – The strongest surface wind gust in the world at the time of 231 mph, is measured on the summit of Mount Washington, New Hampshire. It has since been surpassed.

title: The U.S. Auto
text: • 1934 – The U.S. Auto-Lite strike begins, culminating in a five-day melee between Ohio National Guard troops and 6,000 strikers and picketers.

title: Sir Frank Whittle ground
text: • 1937 – Sir Frank Whittle ground-tests the first jet engine designed to power an aircraft, at Rugby, England.

title: U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt dies in office; Vice President Harry S. Truman becomes President upon Roosevelt's death.
text: • 1945 – U.S. President Franklin D. Roosevelt dies in office; Vice President Harry S. Truman becomes President upon Roosevelt's death.

title: World War II: The U.S. Ninth Army under General William H. Simpson crosses the Elbe River astride Magdeburg, and reached Tangermünde—only 50 miles from Berlin.
text: • 1945 – World War II: The U.S. Ninth Army under General William H. Simpson crosses the Elbe River astride Magdeburg, and reached Tangermünde—only 50 miles from Berlin.

title: The polio vaccine, developed by Dr. Jonas Salk, is declared safe and effective.
text: • 1955 – The polio vaccine, developed by Dr. Jonas Salk, is declared safe and effective.

title: Cold War: Space Race: The Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to travel into outer space and perform the first manned orbital flight, Vostok 1.
text: • 1961 – Cold War: Space Race: The Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin becomes the first human to travel into outer space and perform the first manned orbital flight, Vostok 1.

title: The Soviet nuclear
text: • 1963 – The Soviet nuclear-powered submarine K-33 collides with the Finnish merchant vessel M/S Finnclipper in the Danish straits.

title: Soviet submarine K
text: • 1970 – Soviet submarine K-8, carrying four nuclear torpedoes, sinks in the Bay of Biscay four days after a fire on board.

title: Samuel Doe takes control of Liberia in a coup d'état, ending over 130 years of minority Americo
text: • 1980 – Samuel Doe takes control of Liberia in a coup d'état, ending over 130 years of minority Americo-Liberian rule over the country.

title: The first launch of a Space Shuttle (Columbia) takes place: The STS
text: • 1981 – The first launch of a Space Shuttle (Columbia) takes place: The STS-1 mission.

title: Jim Gary's "Twentieth Century Dinosaurs" exhibition opens at the Smithsonian Institution National Museum of Natural History in Washington, D.C. He is the only sculptor ever invited to present a solo exhibition there.
text: • 1990 – Jim Gary's "Twentieth Century Dinosaurs" exhibition opens at the Smithsonian Institution National Museum of Natural History in Washington, D.C. He is the only sculptor ever invited to present a solo exhibition there.

title: The Euro Disney Resort officially opens with its theme park Euro Disneyland; the resort and its park's name are subsequently changed to Disneyland Paris.
text: • 1992 – The Euro Disney Resort officially opens with its theme park Euro Disneyland; the resort and its park's name are subsequently changed to Disneyland Paris.

title: United States President Bill Clinton is cited for contempt of court for giving "intentionally false statements" in a civil lawsuit; he is later fined and disbarred.
text: • 1999 – United States President Bill Clinton is cited for contempt of court for giving "intentionally false statements" in a civil lawsuit; he is later fined and disbarred.

title: A suicide bomber blows herself up at the entrance to Jerusalem's Mahane Yehuda Market, killing seven people and wounding 104.
text: • 2002 – A suicide bomber blows herself up at the entrance to Jerusalem's Mahane Yehuda Market, killing seven people and wounding 104.

title: A suicide bomber penetrates the Green Zone and detonates in a cafeteria within a parliament building, killing Iraqi MP Mohammed Awad and wounding more than twenty other people.
text: • 2007 – A suicide bomber penetrates the Green Zone and detonates in a cafeteria within a parliament building, killing Iraqi MP Mohammed Awad and wounding more than twenty other people.

title: Zimbabwe officially abandons the Zimbabwean dollar as its official currency.
text: • 2009 – Zimbabwe officially abandons the Zimbabwean dollar as its official currency.

title: Two suicide bombers kill three Chadian soldiers and injure dozens of civilians at a market in Kidal, Mali.
text: • 2013 – Two suicide bombers kill three Chadian soldiers and injure dozens of civilians at a market in Kidal, Mali.

title: The Great Fire of Valparaíso ravages the Chilean city of Valparaíso, killing 16, displacing nearly 10,000, and destroying over 2,000 homes.
text: • 2014 – The Great Fire of Valparaíso ravages the Chilean city of Valparaíso, killing 16, displacing nearly 10,000, and destroying over 2,000 homes.
